N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 175.4 - Driver to fill out daily time record

State Regulations
A driver of a motor truck and/or motor bus shall daily fill
out and keep the daily time record form: (a) Immediately upon going on duty such
driver shall fill in on the daily time record the date, vehicle license number, name of carrier, carrier's main office and terminal address, and the time and
starting point or place the driver goes on duty. (b) Thereafter, the driver shall show on the
daily time record the actual period or periods during the calendar day spent in
the activities specified on lines 1 (off-duty), 2 (sleeper berth), 3 (driving)
and 4 (on duty--not driving), by drawing a continuous line between the
appropriate time markers. Immediately before each change in duty status, he
shall continue the existing continuous line by drawing a vertical line into the
area of the new duty status. (c) When his day's duty is completed, the driver shall fill out all other
information required in the form, and shall sign his name in full in the
appropriate place to certify that the entries are true and correct. The
employer or his responsible agent shall then indicate his knowledge that this
has been done by signing his name on the form in the appropriate
place. Notes
